data.text: @DeesaRoberts Fine, fine... It won't change anything in my life whether the title is part of her name or not. I've got more things to be concerned about.

@DeesaRoberts it was my cellphone autocorrection, but thank you for correcting me. I hope don't make this mistake again ;) 
English is not my first language, i hope you can understand.
@tropicarioca My point is that her last name is no longer Middleton and Meghan's last name is no longer Markle.  So, it is incorrect to refer to them as Kate Middleton and Meghan Markle.
@DeesaRoberts once he has "the royal blood". If she wasn't married to him she wouldn't be the duchess. Well, unless she married another royal family member

@DeesaRoberts I still see it as a tittle. It just defines their position as members of the royal family. Like if someone asks "who's Kate Middleton?" the answer will be "Kate Middleton is the duchess of Cambridge". To be a duchess is the position she ocupes for being William's wife

@tropicarioca According to the birth certificate of Prince Louis, the Duchess of Cambridge's name is Catherine Elizabeth Her Royal Highness The Duchess of Cambridge.  Her name is not Kate Middleton.  Similarly Meghan Markle is not the correct name of the Duchess of Sussex. https://t.co/qlxvNtdPLh
@DeesaRoberts Duchess os their tittle not their real name
